Detailed Description

Objects of this class is used to create and handle coordinate packets.

This class became necessary when the maps started to overlap. It means that a given coordinate not belongs to just one map, but it might be necessary to ask several maps for the closest item.

Definition at line 37 of file CoordinateObject.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CoordinateObject::CoordinateObject (  const RequestData &  parentOrID,
const TopRegionRequest *  topReq,
StringTable::languageCode  language = StringTable::ENGLISH
) 
 

Create a new coordinate object.

Parameters:
parentOrID The request id or the request to get id:s from.
topReq Pointer to valid TopRegionRequest with data
language The prefered language of names.

CoordinateObject::~CoordinateObject (   ) 
 

Destructor that will delete all packets that are allocated here.

This means that even packets that are returned via the getCoordinateReply(int) will be deleted. These packet must therefore not be used after this destructor is called!

Member Function Documentation

int CoordinateObject::addCoordinate (  int32  lat,
int32  lon,
uint32  outDataTypes,
byte  nbrAllowedItemTypes,
const byte *  itemTypes,
uint16  angle = MAX_UINT16
) 
 

Add one coordinate to get the closest item for.

Parameters:
lat The latitude for the coordinate.
lon The longitude for the coordinate.
outDatatypes Bitfiled with the types of data in the reply packet. See flaggs in CoordinateRequestPacket.
nbrAllowedItemTypes The number of elements in the itemTypes-array.
itemTypes An array with the item types that are allowed in the reply. Contains nbrAllowedItemTypes elements.
angle The heading of the vehicle, in degrees from the north direction. This will obly be used when determine the closest segment if the value is <= 360 and the itemTypes-array contains one element and that is StreetSegmentItem.
Returns:
The index of the coordinate, could be used when getting the results.

int CoordinateObject::addOrigDestInfo (  OrigDestInfo &  info  ) 
 

Add an OrigDestInfo to get the closest item for.

The itemID and nodeID of the OrigDestInfo will not be used and only StreetSegmentItems will be allowed.

Parameters:
info The OrigDestInfo to add.
Returns:
The index of the coordinate. Should be used when getting the result.

int CoordinateObject::fillOrigDestInfo (  uint32  index,
OrigDestInfo &  info
) 
 

Fill in the coordinates for the origdestinfo at position index.

Parameters:
index The index of the coordinate, the one you got when adding.
info The info to fill in. Only the mapid and itemid should be changed.
Returns:
index on success. -1 on failure.

CoordinateReplyPacket* CoordinateObject::getCoordinateReply (  uint32  i = 0  ) 
 

Get a reply.

Please notice that the returned packet { must not} be used after that this object is deleted.

Parameters:
i The index of the reply to get. If no parameter is given, the first one will be returned.
Returns:
A pointer to the packet that contains information about the item that is closest to coordinate number i. NULL will be returned upon failure.

bool CoordinateObject::getDone (   )  const
 

Find out if this object is done or not.

It is done when all reply packets have been inserted with the processPacket- method. The getCoordinateReply(int) could be used to get the answers when the object is done.

Returns:
True if this object is done, false otherwise.

PacketContainer* CoordinateObject::getNextPacket (   )  [virtual]
 

Get the next packet to send to the modules.

Returns:
The next packet to send to the modules. NULL will be returned if no packet available.
